turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Hey, since when do you play Thomas Edison?  This looks like Sheila's.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: It is...was. It's a zapper, it might help me stay awake.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Yeah, or turn you into toast.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I can't go back to sleep again.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I haven't slept much either.  Since Kristen...

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: We'll figure it out.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Figure it out?!?!  I'll be insane before I figure it out.  The only thing I'm sure of is that I can't go to sleep.  Not while he's using me.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Then we'll stay up together.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Here you are.  Where were you this morning?  Rick's looking all over for you.

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: Have you seen Joey and Kincaid!  God, I can't find them.  I can't find them anywhere.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I'm sure they're around.

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: Yeah, I'm not so sure.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I love to dream, I just hate ones about my dad.

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: You could do worse.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: My mom taught me when I was little.  Did you ever hear of the dream master?

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: Sounds like a game show host to me.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: No really, it's a fable.  The 'guardian of good' dreams.  It was like my teddy bear when I was growing up.

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: Great, you wouldn't happen to know his phone number?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I daydream.  you have to dream about some place fun.  Remember you're in control.

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: How'd you learn so much about dreams?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: When they're all you have, you kinda become an expert.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: You what?

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: When I used to have nightmares.  I brought my friends in to help me.  Until they all started dying.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Kristen, what happened?

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: You'll hear all kinds of stories. They'll tell you it was murder, but it wasn't.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: You in a hurry?

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: I gotta get to the library before it closes.  Killer physics test.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I know.  I hardly have any time to study.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Maybe you shouldn't be working here so much.  You don't want to get stuck waiting tables for the rest of your life.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Ohhhhbaby, I am dead on my feet.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: We have matching luggage.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: You've been up all night?

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: That obvious, huh?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Then you saw him, too?

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Saw who? I was up all night cramming for this physics test, and I was putting this little baby together.  Look...

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: You're his sister, right?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Rick stayed later after school with Kristen.  She wasn't feeling very well.

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: Tell him I was looking for him, okay?  I'm Dan.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I know.  Uh...Alice.

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: I thought it was an accident.  Smoking in bed.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: It was no suicide.  It was not an accident.  It was Freddy, and he's coming back for seconds, thirds, and fourths.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I was there in the dream.  He took her. It was awful.  It was awful...

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: "In her dream"?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: No, don't!  I gave Sheila to him and now she's dead!

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: Kristen's story really got to her.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I've been working double shifts.

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: Extra money, huh?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Look, you know why, you just don't believe me.

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: No offense, or anything, but it's kind of hard to swallow.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: The story is, the deaths you can't argue with.

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: How long have you been awake?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Three days.

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: Alright, let's assume this whole thing is true. Why does Freddy all of a sudden need you?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Kristen was the last child left of the people who killed Freddy.  Maybe Freddy can't get to new kids without someone like me.  Someone to bring them to him.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Not really.

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: Is there something we can do?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I don't think so.  I guess this is my own war.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: You don't really get it.  He's not a nightstalker.  It'll take more than bench presses to beat him.

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: Why can't we just talk to the authorities?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Yeah, right.  Let's trade death by Freddy for life in a rubber room.  Adults won't see it. They can't.

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: Then what else can we do?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Try what other kids did.  Keep each other awake.  We'll meet at Debbie's tonight. At least if we don't sleep he can't get us.

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: He's going after Debbie, I gotta stop him.

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: Hey, you're not alone.  We have to stop him, I'm with you.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: You just feel sorry for me.

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: Cut that shit out.  Maybe before, but not now. I want to help you. I'm on your side.

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: As long as your driving doesn't kill us.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: It's okay, we're just about there.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: He's going after Debbie.  I gotta stop him.

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: You know, I get the weirdest feeling we've been through this before.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Here we are.

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: Something's wrong here.  It feels like...

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: What the hell was that?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Debbie.  She's gone.  I've...collected her, like the others.

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: You look great!

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Save it for later.  Come on!

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Rick, please.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Alright, I think I see salvation...

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I think Sheila's more interested in dissecting bodies than just admiring them.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Give her time.  Beauty is skin deep.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Asthma attack...what 17-year old has a fatal asthma attack?  She was gonna be a doctor.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: It was Freddy.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Enough of that crap.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I saw it. It was my dream.  I brought Sheila in...

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: T-T-Thanks Alice...

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Earth to Alice...

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: Hey, Rick!

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Excuse me, ladies.  I'll just be a moment.

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: I don't get it.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Let me talk to you.

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: So what's up?  What'd I miss?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: She told us the story of Freddy.  It's a town legend.  He was a child killer who was freed on a technicality.

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: It pissed off a lot of parents. According to Kristen, they hunted him down; roasted him alive.

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: Nice neighborhood.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Now it gets weird.  She says he comes back in dreams.  If he kills you there, you're dead for real.

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: Hey man, we're all sorry...

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: She knew she was gonna die.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Been up with Alice.

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: How she doing?  I ran into her last night.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: She's blaming herself for Sheila.  I know how it feels.  I've been thinking about Kristen.  Maybe I could've stopped it, if I'd listened.

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: About Freddy?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: What else?  You ever look over this town's history?  Not a safe place to be a teenager.  Anyway, if I'm next, watch your back.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Something the matter with the cuisine?

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: Well Mom, I'll tell ya, when two of your friends die the same day, you let me know what it does to your appetite.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: You're just tired.  Don't think I haven't noticed your not sleeping.  That has to stop, honey.

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: What's wrong with me?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Your distraught.  It'll help...

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I'm sorry honey, but...

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: Sorry!! Sorry that you and your tennis pals torched this guy who's now after me. In case you haven't been keeping score, it's his fucking banquet, and I'm the LAST COURSE!!

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Honey, we went over this in therapy.

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: Mother, you've just murdered me.  Take that to your goddamn therapy...

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: Something wrong with the stairs?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Avoid-all-contact-day.

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: When dad's popping aspiring like popcorn, it's avoid-all-contact-day.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: Oh God!  He killed them!

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: Now you know who and what Freddy really is.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I though Freddy was just an old town story.

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: It's no story.  It happened.  Freddy's real and he's back.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I'll tell you later.

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: It's no just a house. It's his home. He's waiting there for me...to dream.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: It's okay, babe.  We're with you.

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: I told you you can't help.  This isn't a normal nightmare. I'm doomed.

turns.speaker: NURSE
turns.text: Feeling better now?

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: Yeah.  I guess so... What happened?

turns.speaker: NURSE
turns.text: You had a nasty bump.

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: I gotta get out of here.

turns.speaker: NURSE
turns.text: You just stay put.  You need rest.

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: You don't get it, he's after me...

turns.speaker: NURSE
turns.text: Don't worry, honey

turns.speaker: MRS. JORDAN
turns.text: Excuse us, dear.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: It's okay, Dan

turns.speaker: MRS. JORDAN
turns.text: Frankly, dear, we wondered what you intend to do with our baby?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: What I what?  Well, I've thought about it.  I plan to keep him.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Look, I appreciate what you're offering, but no.  He is my responsibility.

turns.speaker: MRS. JORDAN
turns.text: And ours.  It's our grandchild.

turns.speaker: MRS. JORDAN
turns.text: In your present condition, Alice, we're worried about your ability --

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: What are you talking about?  My "condition"?...

turns.speaker: MRS. JORDAN
turns.text: We know you've been through a lot but there's more than your feelings at stake here.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: You're not taking my baby!

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Hey...wake up.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Shouldn't you be in your room, Jacob?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: It's lonely in there, in my room.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: My name is...

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I'm sorry your boyfriend got killed.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: How did you know that?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I could tell you were sad.  I just wanted to see if you were all right.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Hi, you don't look very well.  Are you feeling all right?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Been having bad dreams.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Is that who you're waiting for?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I don't think this is a nice place for you to be.  Maybe we should go find your Mom.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: She doesn't want me around

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Oh...I'm sure that's not true.  I'll bet she's very worried about you.  I would be.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: No you're not.  You don't even care about being a mom.  How come you don't think about me?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Who said I...wait, what?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Who says I don't like you?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: My friend, with the funny hand.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Mommy...?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Come on downstairs.  He won't hurt you. He needs us both.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Where is he?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: He's inside you, where he hides.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: It's where he hides out.  Inside.  That's how he found me.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: But how...?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: He says it's easy.  Especially with sad people.  With closed-off people.

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: Hi, beautiful.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Jesus!  Don't do that!

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: Sorry, babe.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: The tickets.

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: They're coach seats, but the plane lands in Paris.  It's gonna be a helluva summer, hon!

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: Okay, babe.  What's the matter?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Nothing...it's just...I didn't see my father at the ceremony.

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: He'll show up.  C'mon, what's really wrong?

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: About him?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: No.  Well, not exactly...it's that...I felt like I wasn't in control.  For the first time since...all that.  I'm scared.

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: You stopped it didn't you?  It was probably just a regular bad dream.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Yeah...I guess.

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: You don't dream him up, he can't hurt you.  Or me.  Or us.  Remember...

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: You're right.

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: There you go.  Love you.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Me too.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I was afraid you weren't coming.

turns.speaker: ALICE'S DAD
turns.text: I watched from behind the stands.  Didn't want to embarrass you, ya know.  "The drunk showed up", that kind of thing...

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: That's in the past.  Unless you've stopped going to the meetings.

turns.speaker: ALICE'S DAD
turns.text: No.  A deal's a deal.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Dad!

turns.speaker: ALICE'S DAD
turns.text: It's the model you've been saving up for. I wanted you to have it for your trip.

turns.speaker: ALICE'S DAD
turns.text: Where are we going?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: To take a picture.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Thanks for everything, Dad.

turns.speaker: ALICE'S DAD
turns.text: You sure you don't want a ride to work?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: It's just across the park.

turns.speaker: ALICE'S DAD
turns.text: I'm so sorry, honey...

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Daddy, he's coming back...Krueger's coming back.  Make them understand.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: How was the meeting?

turns.speaker: ALICE'S DAD
turns.text: Sobering...

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Very funny.

turns.speaker: ALICE'S DAD
turns.text: Alice...

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Since when are you such a smart shopper?

turns.speaker: ALICE'S DAD
turns.text: Since my little girl became a mom...

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: You disappointed in me?

turns.speaker: ALICE'S DAD
turns.text: No, I'm not.  I sort of hope it's a boy. Be nice to have a boy playing in the house again.

turns.speaker: ALICE'S DAD
turns.text: Alice!

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I've got to go.

turns.speaker: ALICE'S DAD
turns.text: No!  I won't have you running around in the middle of the night.  You're coming home.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: But Dad --

turns.speaker: ALICE'S DAD
turns.text: Now.

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: Hey, what's wrong with you -- let's see a smile.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Had kind of a long night.

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: Dan keeping you up again?  Put a lock on that window, girl.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: No, the Dan part was nice...

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Good to see you again, Mr. Grey.  I've got to go find Dan.

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: Yeah, before they revoke his diploma.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: It was no accident.  It was Krueger.  He used to get in through my dreams, but not anymore.  He's found some other way.

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: Alice, it's no dream.  I'm sorry...Dan's dead.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Have you visited the little boy on my floor?  Jacob, the one who looks kind of sad?

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: There aren't any little boys on your floor.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: He must've wandered up from the children's ward.  I just wondered what was wrong with him.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Did everyone call everyone?

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: They're waiting for us...but let's keep this dream stuff between you and me.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: What's that got to do with it?

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: When Dan died you weren't even asleep. You said so.  End of story.

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: It was just an accident.  Like with Dan.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: No accident.  I tried to warn all of you about Krueger.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I don't understand what's happening. Krueger has to use my dreams, but he got to Dan and Greta while I was awake. How's he doing it?

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: Why don't you two stick to reality.

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: You had me scared on the phone.  What's wrong with the baby?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I think Krueger's trying to do something to it.

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: Oh, Alice...no.  Honey, I love you but you're going to have to get a hold of yourself...

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Mark knows I'm not crazy.  Ask him to show you his hands.

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: I really think you need to calm down now, okay?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I just can't figure out how he's getting in when I'm awake...

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: I am your friend, and I'm worried sick about you.  But, you're like a locked safe.  You've gotta start dealing with reality.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Krueger is reality.

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: And so is your baby.  You've got more than just yourself to think of now!

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: What do you think I'm doing?  Look.  Whether you believe it or not, Krueger is back.  He's after the baby and if I don't try to do something about it, who will??

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: All I know is that you are not doing yourself or the baby any good by acting like a crazy woman.  Why don't you take off - leave Springwood and cool out somewhere for a while?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Goddamn it, Yvonne!  You don't just run away from this guy!  He finds you in your dreams.

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: Look...we're all tired.  None of us had any sleep since Friday night...

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: That's the only reason you're alive...

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Are you alright?

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: Yeah...So that's him.  And you're not crazy.

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: You think that's the place she's buried?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: If they actually bothered to bury her.

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Jacob.  We've got to get to Amanda before it's too late.

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: But how are we gonna --

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: We've got to go to the asylum and find her body.  Mark said her soul's trapped with it -- that's why she can't come to me.  It must be!

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: You do good work, Alice.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: So did Dan.

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: He sure loves to stay awake.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: That's okay.  He's got the rest of his life to catch up on his sleep.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Give up, Mark, it's hopeless.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: I think I'm starting to wear her down.  Have some anyway.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Not to mention the heartbreak of psoriasis.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Greta, come on.  One burger with me?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: My dad's got this thing about drinking in the house.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Well we gotta do something!

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: I've got to write some of this down.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: That's why it's my fault Dan's dead.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Mark, are you okay?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Yeah.  I'm just aces.
